author: Special Correspondent
text:
Indiya Jananayaka Katchi (IJK) founder-leader Pari Vendar said the party which was part of the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the State would take a call on continuing in the front at its general council meeting on February 20.

Mr. Vendar who was on a private visit here on Saturday, told reporters that the party would decide its electoral strategy for the coming assembly elections at the general council to be held in Madurai on February 20.

During his interaction, a majority of the district presidents expressed the view that the party should walk out from the BJP-led alliance and face the election on its own. “We will decide whether to go it alone or forge an alliance at the general council meet,” he said.

The party, in the 2011 assembly elections, had contested 121 seats and secured sizeable votes in many constituencies. Since then, the party grew from strength to strength and emerged as a force to reckon with, he claimed. In the event of party going it alone, it would offer 50 per cent reservation for women and field women candidates in 117 of the 234 seats, he said.
title: IJK to decide on poll alliance on February 20
